original_theorem: Let $X_1, \dots, X_n$ be a sequence of independent and identically distributed (i.i.d.) random variables from a Bernoulli distribution with parameter $p$, where $0 < p < 1$. Let the sample mean be defined as $\bar{X}_n = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^n X_i$. Determine the expected value of the sample mean, $E[\bar{X}_n]$, the variance of the sample mean, $Var(\bar{X}_n)$, and the limit of the variance as $n \to \infty$.
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem bernoulli_sample_mean_properties {Î© : Type*} [MeasureSpace Î©]
  {X : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {p : â„} (hp_pos : 0 < p) (hp_lt_one : p < 1)
  (h_i_i_d : âˆ€ i, IsBernoulli (X i) p) (h_indep : iIndepFun (fun i => (X i)) MeasureSpace.volume h_i_i_d) :
  let X_bar_n (n : â„•) := fun Ï‰ : Î© => (1 / (n : â„)) * (âˆ‘ i in Finset.range n, X i Ï‰)
  âˆ€ n : â„•, n > 0 â†’
  (Expectation (X_bar_n n) = p âˆ§
  variance (X_bar_n n) = p * (1 - p) / n) âˆ§
  Tendsto (fun n' : â„• => if hn' : n' > 0 then variance (X_bar_n n') else 0) atTop (ğ“ 0) := by
```
